markdownRemark.html:
I was writing ld-vue when I needed a way to pass arguments to my Vue mixin. In my case, I needed to pass a client id to an external library so it can be initialised.

This is the technique I ended up using to pass params to my mixin:

import someLibrary from 'some-library';

const exampleMixin = clientId => ({
  methods: {
    init: function() {
      someLibrary.initialize(clientId);
    },
  },
})

export default exampleMixin

Instead of defining an object, define a function which returns the mixin object. Pass any arguments or parameters you want to this function. Then using closure, you can access these in your mixin.

That's it!
